snippet: Four years ago, the commission seemed enthusiastic about adopting global rules for foreign companies traded in the United States, and set out a schedule that it said could lead to adoption of those rules for American companies.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission releases a long-delayed study about use of international accounting standards in the United States; report contains no recommendations, but its general tone is far more cautious than proponents of the use of international standards had hoped.
lead_paragraph: Four years ago, the commission seemed enthusiastic about adopting global rules for foreign companies traded in the United States, and set out a schedule that it said could lead to adoption of those rules for American companies.
